0.text:
The process starts in three different places. For the company, the process begins when they receive a job application. The company confirms and rates the application. These actions happen in parallel.  Then, based on the received confirmation and rating, the company decides whether to decline the applicant, in which case the process ends for the company with no employee found, or to negotiate an interview. If the interview is negotiated, the company rates the job seeker and decides whether to hire them or decline, ending respectively with the company either finding or not finding an employee.

From the job seeker's perspective, the process starts, they report their application status and go through job offers. They then apply for a job, after which they receive job offers and decide to either decline, which brings them back to reporting the application status, or accept and enter a probation phase.  Once in the probationary phase, they rate the company. If the company is rated C or less, the job seeker goes back to reviewing job offers. If the rating is greater than C, the seeker moves to a permanent position, at which point this process ends for them with them having found a job.

The third starting point is with the job platform, which sends out job offers. It analyses reports and forwards job applications, then splits to receive the applicant rating and confirmation in parallel. These received ratings and confirmations are joined before a decision on the application is made. If declined, the platform sends out more offers. If accepted, the platform receives the job seeker and company ratings in parallel, which are joined and trigger the job platform to end the process, having successfully conveyed a job when both ratings are acceptable or the company rating is greater than C and the seeker accepts; otherwise the platform sends more job offers.

1.text: The process starts in three separate places.  For the company, the process begins when they receive a job application. The company confirms the application and rates the application. These happen in parallel.  Based on the confirmation and application rating, the company decides whether to decline the applicant, in which case the process ends with no employee found, or to proceed with negotiating an interview.  If the interview is negotiated, the company rates the job seeker. Based on the seeker rating, the company decides whether to decline the applicant, again ending the process with no employee found or to hire the prospective customer, in which case the process ends with an employee found.  For the job seeker, the process starts when they report their application status. They then go through job offers and apply for a job. Following the application, the job seeker waits for the application status. If declined, the process loops back to reporting the application status. If accepted, the seeker enters the probation phase, rates the company and, depending on their rating of C or less, loops back to reviewing job offers, or moves onto a permanent job, ending the job seeker's process.  The job platform process starts when job offers are sent.  These offers are then analyzed, and the application is forwarded.  The forwarding is followed by the platform receiving the application rating and job confirmation simultaneously. Based on these, the platform decides whether to decline and send more job offers or, if the application is accepted, it waits to concurrently receive the company rating and seeker rating. If the company rating and seeker rating are declined, job offers are sent again. If accepted the process ends with the job conveyed.

2.text: The process starts in three different places simultaneously. For the company, the process begins when they receive a job application. The company confirms the application and rates the application.  The Job Seeker starts when they report their application status and then go through job offers. For the job platform, the process starts when job offers are sent from the company and then analysed. The job platform forwards the application which the company receives. The company then confirms and rates the application.  These actions trigger messages to the job platform, which receives the job confirmation and application rating. Based on the received information, the job platform may send decline messages which results in no employee being found. If the company accepts the application, they negotiate an interview with the job seeker and rate the job seeker. At the same time, if the job seeker's initial application is accepted by the platform, the job seeker enters a probation phase.  The seeker rates the company, sending this rating to the platform. The seeker can also decline at this stage, resulting in the process ending without a job.  The company's rating of the job seeker is also sent to the platform. If the company accepts the job seeker after the interview, they hire the prospective customer, ending the process with "Found employee".  If they decline, the process ends with "Found no employee". The platform evaluates the company and seeker ratings. If both the seeker is accepted and the company rating is greater than C, the process ends with "Conveyed job", and if they are declined a job offer is sent and processed again by the platform.  If the company is rated C or less, the job seeker goes back to reviewing job offers. If the company is rated higher than C, the job seeker moves to a permanent job, ending the process with "Found job".

0.text: The process begins when a student has the desire to register for a USI course.  The student first selects a course. The application then checks if slots are free. If not, the student selects another course. If so, the application shows the available dates. The student then selects one date and checks if they have an account at the sports institute. If they do, the application checks if the student is registered at an eligible university. If they are not, the student registers with an account and the application checks again. If the student is registered, they send a request for activation to the application, and wait for a response. Meanwhile, if the student does have an account at the sports institute, the application immediately checks if they are registered at an eligible university. If they are, the process converges and the student proceeds as if they just registered a new account. If the application is activated, the student logs into their account and provides payment information. The application then completes the registration for the course. At this point, two parallel actions are triggered: The application receives the ticket, and the student tweets their friends. Once both actions are complete, the process ends.

1.text: The process begins with the student's desire to register for a USI course.  The student first selects a course. The application then checks if slots are free. If not, the student selects another course. If slots are free, the application shows the available dates, and the student selects one.  Next, the student checks if they have an account at the sports institute. If they do, the application checks if the account is available.  Concurrently, the student also checks if they are registered at an eligible university. If they are not registered, the student registers and the application checks if registration is complete. If the student was already registered, the check completes immediately.  If the student does not have a sports institute account, they also check if they are registered at an eligible university. If registered at university, they create an account at the sports institute. If not registered, they are prompted to register by the application and the check for university registration ensues as previously described.  If the application determines the sports institute account is available, the processes converge, and the student logs into their account and provides payment information. The application then completes the registration for the course.  In parallel, the application receives the ticket and the student tweets their friends. Finally, the process ends.

2.text: The process begins when a student has the desire to register for a USI course.  The student first selects a course using the application. Next, the application checks if slots are free. If not, the student selects another course. If so, the application shows the available dates, and the student selects one. The student then checks if they have an account available at the sports institute. If not, the student checks if they are registered at an eligible university. If not, the student provides registration information, sends a request for activation and waits for a response before proceeding. If the student does have an account at the sports institute or is registered at an eligible university, or once they receive a response to their activation request, they proceed with logging into their account (if they had one), or registering a new account otherwise. After logging in or registering, the student provides payment information. The application then completes the registration for the course.  In parallel, the student tweets their friends about the registration, and the application receives the ticket.  Once the ticket is received and the friends are tweeted, the process ends.

0.text: The process "Ordering in an online shop" starts when a user wants to login. The user enters their login data, which the e-shop then checks. If the credentials are correct, the user can select a product.  After selecting a product, the e-shop saves the item and the user is asked if they want to select other products. If they do, the user selects another product and the process loops back. If they don't, or if this loop has already executed once, the user proceeds to check if every selected item is in the shopping cart, before confirming the order.  Upon confirmation, the e-shop prepares the shipment and payment details in parallel.  The user then enters their payment data, which is sent to the bank, and in parallel enters their shipping details. The process continues once both payment data and shipping details have been entered. The e-shop waits for bank confirmation.  If the bank confirms the payment data, the order is confirmed and saved by the e-shop, and the process ends.  If the bank does not confirm the payment data, or if the login credentials were incorrect at the start of the process, the process ends without saving the order.

1.text: The process "Ordering in an online shop" starts when a user wants to login. The user enters their login data, which is then checked by the e-shop.  If the data is correct, the user selects a product. After selecting a product, the e-shop saves the item. The user is then asked if they want to select other products. If they do, they select another product, and the process loops back. If not, or if the login data was incorrect, the user confirms the order.  After confirming the order, the e-shop prepares the shipment and payment details in parallel. The user enters their payment data and shipping details, also in parallel. The payment data is sent to the bank. The e-shop waits for confirmation from the bank and the user to finish entering shipping details.  If the bank confirms the payment data, and the user finishes their details, the e-shop confirms and saves the order. If the bank does not confirm the payment data, the process moves forward. Once the order is saved, the process ends.

tasks.name: Wait for user to finish shipping details

2.text: The process begins when a user wants to login to an online shop. The user enters their login data, which is then checked by the e-shop. If the data is correct, the user selects a product. The selected product is added to the shopping cart and saved by the e-shop. The user is then asked if they want to select other products. If yes, the process loops back to product selection. If no, the user confirms the order.  Upon order confirmation, the e-shop prepares the shipment and payment details in parallel. After entering payment data, the user also enters shipping details. The e-shop sends the payment data to the bank and waits for confirmation. Once the user has entered shipping details, and the bank confirms the payment data, the e-shop confirms and saves the order. Finally, the process ends. If at any point the login data or payment data is incorrect, the order is not confirmed, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Add product to shopping cart and save
Ask if user wants to select other products

0.text: The process "DIY Repair of a Broken Smartphone Screen" starts when the phone is broken. The user enters the manufacturer, model, and the broken part.  The online tool starts to compute the parts list and the necessary tools in parallel. After the user has entered all information about the broken phone they check their inventory. If all parts and tools are in stock they proceed; otherwise they are asked if they want to contact a friend. If they contact a friend, the friend helps getting everything else needed. If the user doesn't contact a friend, they are getting everything else needed themselves. Independent of contacting a friend or not, afterwards the online tool generates instructions on how to fix the phone and the user follows these instructions. The online tool joins the parallel running tasks of computing parts and tools. After each step of the instructions, the user is asked, if there is another step to follow. If yes, they follow the next step of the instruction. If there is no other step to follow, the user checks if the phone is working now. If it is not working, the user is going to send their phone to an expert and after that the process ends. If the phone is now working the user will leave a review and is asked if they want to upload a video. If yes, they upload a video, and it is saved by the online tool to a database. Afterwards or if the user decides not to upload a video, the process ends, and the phone is repaired. The online tool joins the saving video and the end event.

tasks.name: Generate instructions on how to fix the phone
Check if the phone is working

gateways.name: All parts and tools in stock?

1.text: The process "DIY Repair of a Broken Smartphone Screen" starts when the phone is broken. The user first enters the manufacturer, then the model, and finally the broken part.  The online tool then computes the parts list and the necessary tools in parallel. Once both computations are finished, the user checks if the needed items are available in their own inventory. If the parts and tools are available, instructions to fix the phone are generated by the online tool. If not, the user decides whether to contact a friend. If the user chooses to contact a friend, the friend helps in getting everything else needed, after which the online tool generates instructions to fix the phone. If the user decides not to contact a friend, the user proceeds to get everything that is needed themselves and then instructions to fix the phone are generated. The user then follows the generated instructions. After each step, the instructions are checked to see if there are further steps. If further steps exist, the user continues following the instructions. If there are no further steps in the instructions, the user checks if the phone is working. If the phone is not working, the user can choose to send the phone to an expert or to repeat the steps of following the instructions. If the user chooses to send the phone to an expert, after the phone is returned the process ends with the user optionally leaving a review and optionally uploading a video of the repair, after which the process ends with the phone repaired. If the phone is working, the user can leave a review and optionally upload a video of the repair. After leaving a review and optionally uploading a video, the process ends with the phone repaired.  If a video is uploaded, it is saved to a database by the online tool, after which the user optionally leaves a review before the process ends with the phone repaired.

tasks.name: Check if needed items are available

2.text: The process "DIY Repair of a Broken Smartphone Screen" starts when a phone is broken. The user starts by entering the manufacturer, model, and the broken part into an online tool.  The online tool then computes the parts list and the necessary tools in parallel.  Once both are completed, the user checks if they have the necessary tools and parts. If they do, the online tool generates instructions to fix the phone. If not, the user is asked if they want to contact a friend. If yes, they contact the friend, and after the contact, the user gets everything else needed and the online tool proceeds with generating instructions. If the user doesn't want to contact a friend, they get everything else needed directly, and the online tool then generates instructions. The user then follows the generated instructions. Afterward, they are asked if the instructions have another step. If yes, the user continues following the instructions. If not, they are asked if the phone is working. If the phone isn't working, the user sends the phone to an expert. After sending it, the user goes to the online tool and gives feedback via "Leave Review". If the phone is working, the user can also "Leave Review".  After the review, the user is asked if they want to upload a video. If yes, they upload the video, the online tool saves the video to the database, and the process ends. If the user chooses not to upload a video after the review, the process ends as well. If the user decides not to upload a video but did so earlier after an expert repair, then after the video is saved, the user ends the process via "Leave Review" again.

0.text: The process starts with the user opening Battle.net. The user is then asked if they are registered. If not registered, the user enters their account information, after which Battle.net sends a confirmation email. The user clicks the link in the email. Next, the user logs into Battle.net. If already registered, the user immediately proceeds to log in. After logging in, account information is loaded.  The user is then asked if their WOW subscription is active.  If not active, the user selects a payment method, either credit card or bank account. If the user selects credit card, they enter their credit card information. If the user selects bank account, they enter their IBAN and BIC. After entering payment information, the subscription becomes active and payment is processed. Whether the subscription was active initially or just became active, the user then logs into the game. Once logged in, the game loads ingame data and position. Simultaneously, the user selects their realm, race, and class.  Finally, the user names their character, after which Battle.net sends a confirmation and selfies, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with the user opening Battle.net. The user is then asked if they are registered. If not registered, the user enters their account information.  Battle.net then sends a confirmation email, and the user clicks on the link in the email.  This leads the user to enter their account information again. Whether registered or not, the user will eventually log into Battle.net. Account information is loaded. Next, the process checks if the WOW subscription is active. If not active, the user selects a payment method, either credit card or bank account. If the user selects credit card, they enter their credit card information. If the user selects bank account, they enter their IBAN and BIC. After entering payment information, the process proceeds. If the WOW subscription is active, the process also proceeds.  The user then logs into the game, at which point ingame data and position are loaded.  Concurrently, the user selects a realm, race, and class. Following these selections, the user names their character.  Battle.net sends a confirmation and selfies to the user. Finally, the process ends.

2.text: The process starts by opening Battle.net.  The user is then asked if they are registered. If not, they enter their account information, which leads to clicking on a link in a confirmation email sent from Battle.net. The user then proceeds as if they were registered. If registered, they log into Battle.net. After logging in (or confirming registration), account information is loaded. The process then checks if the WOW subscription is active.  If not, the user selects a payment method.  If the chosen method is credit card, the user enters their credit card information. If the chosen method is bank account, they enter their IBAN and BIC.  Both payment options converge, and the payment is processed. If the WOW subscription *is* active, the process proceeds directly to logging into the game. After payment or confirmation of an active subscription, the user logs into the game. Game data and position are then loaded in parallel with logging into the game.  Following the login and data loading, the user selects a realm, race, and class simultaneously. The choices are then combined to name the character. Finally, Battle.net sends a confirmation and selfies to the user, after which the process ends.

0.text: The process starts when a customer wishes to build a house. The customer collects requirements and sends them to the architect.  Simultaneously, the customer refines the requirements. The architect replies to the customer with a draft. Based on whether the draft is sufficient, the customer either refines the requirements or continues. The refined requirements are sent back to the architect.  Following this, the customer checks if the building project is subject to approval. If approval is needed, the customer reports for a building permit, and based on the permit result creates an order list. If no approval is needed, the customer proceeds directly to creating the order list. After the order list is created, the customer places an order with Amadon, and simultaneously calculates effort. Based on the calculated effort and the customer’s decision on affordability, the customer either hires a building company or calls friends. If a building company is hired, the process proceeds to the next step. If friends are called, the customer continues the process by hiring a building company. Amadon sends an order to the customer. After the house is built, the building process is completed, marking the end of the process.

1.text: The process starts with the customer's wish to build a house. The customer collects requirements and, at the same time, sends requirements to the architect.  The architect sends back a draft to the customer.  The customer checks if the draft is sufficient.  If not, the requirements are refined and sent again to the architect, after which the architect creates a new draft which is sent again to the customer to check if the draft is sufficient. This is repeated as long as the draft is not considered sufficient by the customer. Once the draft is sufficient, the process will check if a building permit is needed.  If yes, the customer reports for a building permit and, upon receipt, creates an order list. If no building permit is required, the customer goes directly to creating the order list.  After creating the order list, the customer places the order, which is sent to Amadon.  At the same time, the customer calculates the effort required and starts two parallel paths.  One path involves hiring a building company, after which the company starts building the house.  In parallel, on the other path, the customer awaits the order from Amadon. After the arrival of the order, two parallel paths will start. One is the already started house building. The other path checks whether the building project is affordable. If it is, the building company will continue building the house.  If the project is deemed unaffordable, the customer calls their friends and the process of building the house by the building company is initiated by the customer.  Once the house is built, the process ends.

2.text: The process starts when a customer wishes to build a house. The customer collects requirements and sends those requirements to an architect.  The customer then refines the requirements. Based on the refined requirements the customer sends the requirements to the architect again. The architect sends back a draft which is received by the customer.  The customer checks the feasibility of the requirements based on the draft.  If the draft is not sufficient, the customer refines the requirements, sends the requirements to the architect and receives another draft and checks the feasibility of the requirements. This loop can repeat until the draft is considered sufficient. Once the draft is sufficient the customer checks if the build is subject to approval.  If it is, the customer reports for a building permit, and joins the 'no' path from the decision to whether the building is subject to approval. If not subject to approval, the customer continues on the same 'no' path.   From that point the customer creates an order list and places the order with Amazon. At the same time, the customer calculates effort, which may or may not be affordable. If affordable, the customer hires a building company. If not affordable, the customer calls friends, who then complete steps that would have been done by the building company. Concurrently with hiring the building company/calling friends, the order is placed with Amazon and Amazon sends the order to the customer. Once the order is received and the building company is hired or friends are ready, the house is built. Building the house ends the process.

0.text: The process starts when an incident happens. The assessment tool is started, which then prompts the user to enter the incident type.  Based on the incident type, the process branches into four parallel paths: Accident, almost accident, severe safety/health risk, and defective protective equipment. Each of these paths converges to a point where further incident details are specified. Next, it is checked if the victim is a student. If yes, two parallel tasks are added: contact superiors and contact accident insurance. These are followed by additional checks. If the victim has private insurance, the task “contact private insurance” is added. Regardless of private insurance, the process proceeds to propose tasks to the user. If the victim is not a student, the process checks if the person is self-employed and if the accident happened to them. If so, the user enters their own data, otherwise they enter the victim’s data. This is followed by the check if the person killed/severely injured? if yes and if it was already reported to the safety authorities, then the task “add task: contact accident insurance” will be added, then the rest of the tasks proposed. If not reported to the authorities, then in parallel the tasks “add task: contact accident insurance” and “add task: contact  Labour Inspectorate” are added. In case of no severe injuries, if the incident was not reported, “add task: contact  Labour Inspectorate” is added, then “add task: contact superiors” If the incident had been reported to safety authorities, the process continues directly to “add task: contact superiors” After any of these scenarios, the process proceeds to proposing tasks to the user. Once the proposed tasks are executed, the process ends.

gateways.name: Self-employed and accident happened to them?

1.text: The process starts when an incident happens. The assessment tool is started. The tool starts and prompts the user to enter the incident type.  Based on the incident type, one of the following computerized actions happen: Accident, almost accident, severe safety risk/health risk, or defective protective equipment.  The user is then prompted to further specify the incident. Next, the victim's data is entered.  If the victim is a student, additional tasks are added based on whether they are also self-employed and the incident happened to them. If they are not a student, it is checked whether they are self-employed and the incident happened to them. If so, the user enters their own data before entering the victim's data.  Afterwards, it is determined if the person was killed or severely injured. If yes and the incident was already reported to safety authorities, it goes to the next step. If not reported yet,  a task is added to contact the Labour Inspectorate.  Regardless of injuries, it is checked whether the incident was reported. If not, the task to contact the Labour Inspectorate is added. Next, in parallel, a task to contact accident insurance is added and it is checked again if the incident has been reported to authorities.  If reported, the additional task to contact accident insurance is added.  Regardless of person killed/severely injured the following tasks are added, if applicable: if the victim is a student: contact superiors, contact principal; if the victim is not a student: contact accident insurance and/or if applicable private insurance (if applicable if they have one).  Finally, the proposed tasks are executed and the process ends.

tasks.name: Computerized action based on incident type

gateways.name: Self-employed and incident happened to them?

2.text: The process starts when an incident happens. The assessment tool is started. The tool starts and prompts the user to enter the incident type.  Based on the incident type, the process branches into four parallel paths: Accident, almost accident, severe safety risk/health risk, and defective protective equipment. All four paths converge, and the user is prompted to further specify the incident. Next, the victim's data is entered. Subsequently, it is checked whether the victim is a student. If the victim is a student, specific tasks are added - contact superiors, and contact the principal. If not, a check is performed to determine if the victim is self-employed and if the accident happened to them.  If they are self-employed and the accident happened to them, the user enters their own data, after which this path joins the main process flow. If the victim is not self-employed or the accident didn't happen to them, the process proceeds directly to the main flow. Next, the process checks if the person was killed or severely injured. If so, the task to contact accident insurance is added and it is also checked if the incident was already reported to safety authorities.  Regardless of whether it was reported or not, the task to contact accident insurance is executed. If the person was not killed or severely injured, a task to contact superiors is added, which is then followed by the same check regarding reporting to safety authorities. If not yet reported, the task to contact the labor inspectorate is added. Finally, the proposed tasks are executed, and after completion, it's checked if the victim has private insurance. If yes, the task to contact private insurance is added. All the added tasks are proposed to the user. The user executes the proposed tasks, and once all tasks are done, the process ends.

gateways.name: Self-Employed and Accident Happened to Them?

0.text: The process starts with creating an account, followed by specifying basic information.  The user then decides whether a bank account is needed and whether to provide residence information. If a bank account is needed, the user browses bank account offers and applies for one. If the application is accepted, the user uploads the form and attaches bank approval, leading to the process ending with "bank account uploaded". If the application is rejected, the user can browse bank account offers again. If the user provides residence information, they are asked if they have a residence. If yes, the user proceeds to make a plan about how to get an apartment.  If no, the user proceeds to make a plan about how to get an apartment. After making a plan, the user can either use the provided tool to browse open apartments or try to get an apartment on their own.  If browsing open apartments, the user conducts a virtual round-tour with the landlord. Afterward, the process checks if there is mutual interest in renting. If so, the user signs the contract. If not, the process loops back to the user's decision on how to acquire an apartment. If trying to get an apartment on one's own, the process asks if this worked out. If yes, the user signs the contract. If not, the process loops back to the user's decision on how to acquire an apartment. After signing the contract, the user uploads the apartment contract.  Concurrently with the above steps, if the user chooses to provide job information, they decide if the information fits RWR card regulations. If yes, they proceed. If not, they browse open positions, create a digital CV, and continue with the job process. If the information fits RWR card regulations, the user also goes through creating a digital CV and browsing job positions. They then send the application and wait for an invitation. If they receive an invite, they attend the job interview, leading to the decision of whether there is mutual interest in cooperation. If yes, they negotiate a contract; if no, they can choose to send applications again or end the job search. If a contract is negotiated, there's a check for an agreement. If an agreement is reached, they upload the work contract and insurance documents, and if not they return to sending another application. Once the apartment contract and/or job/insurance documents are uploaded, an application for or renewal of an RWR card is sent. The application/renewal triggers a message event and two years later, a timer event prompts the user to decide about their future. This process can involve re-applying for the RWR card. If not, it ends with "RWR card irrelevant".  Alternatively, an unsuccessful apartment search eventually leads to the process ending with "ended with no success".

tasks.name: Upload Form and Attach Bank Approval
Make a Plan to Get an Apartment
Try to Get an Apartment on One's Own
Upload Work Contract and Insurance Documents

1.text:
The process starts with creating an account, followed by specifying basic information.  The user then decides whether a bank account is needed. If so, the user browses bank account offers and applies for one.  If the application is accepted, the user uploads the bank approval.  Regardless of the bank account application outcome, the process continues. The user decides to either provide residence information or provide job information, or both.


If the user provides residence information, they are asked if they have a residence. If they do, the contract is signed, and then uploaded. If not, they can choose to make a plan to get an apartment and then use the provided tool to browse open apartments. Alternatively, they can try to get an apartment on their own. If using the tool, they conduct a virtual round-tour with the landlord and if mutually interested in rent, the contract is signed and then uploaded.  If they tried on their own, the user indicates if it worked out. If it did, the contract is signed and then uploaded. Regardless of how the user finds an apartment, once the apartment contract is uploaded, the process continues.


If the user provides job information, the process checks if the information fits RWR card regulations. If yes, the user uploads work contract and insurance documents, after which the user sends a (re)application for the RWR card.  If the job information does not fit the regulations, the user creates a digital CV and browses a list of open positions.  The next step is to either browse open positions or create a digital CV (or both). The user then decides whether to send the application. If so, the application is sent, and if the employer sends an invitation, the user attends a job interview. If mutually interested in cooperation, they negotiate the contract. If they agree, the user uploads the contract and insurance documents, followed by sending a (re)application for the RWR card. If there is no agreement at any point in this path, the process goes back to decide if an application is to be sent.

After sending the RWR card application, the application is received and processed, and the user decides what to do about their future. Two years later, a timer event triggers, and the user is asked if they want to renew.  If so, the user can either choose to provide residence information or job information (or both), and the process continues as before. If not, the process ends. The process may also end if the user is not invited to a job interview, if the user and employer don't mutually agree on cooperation, or if the bank account upload was successful.

tasks.name: Make a Plan to Get an Apartment
Try to Get an Apartment on Your Own
Indicate if Apartment Search Worked Out
Check if Information Fits RWR Card Regulations
Upload Work Contract and Insurance Documents

gateways.name: Browse Open Positions or Create CV?

2.text: The process starts with creating an account, followed by specifying basic information.  The user then decides whether a bank account is needed. If so, the user browses bank account offers.  Independently, the process splits to concurrently provide residence info and  job info. When providing residence information, the user decides whether they have a residence. If yes, they might provide the residence info for the Red-White-Red card process depending on whether it fits the RWR card regulations. If they don't have a residence, they make a plan on how to get an apartment and the process continues as described below in the context of apartment search. If the bank account is needed, the user browses offers and applies for one. If the bank account application is accepted, the user uploads the form and attaches bank approval, leading to the process ending with "bank account uploaded".  If not accepted, the user again browses bank account offers and the process loops back to applying for a bank account. Once the basic information is specified, the process also involves concurrently browsing open apartments and creating a digital CV. Following this, the process splits to browse job positions and also prepare for apartment search by creating a digital CV. The next step involves sending a job application and, based on invitation status, either attending a job interview or not pursuing the application further. If they attend the interview, the process assesses the mutual interest in cooperation. If there is mutual interest, the user negotiates a contract. Regardless of mutual interest, the process proceeds to sending the application for an RWR card. Concurrently, if the user uses the provided tool for their apartment search, they browse open apartments and, based on a virtual round-tour with the landlord, assess the mutual interest in rent.  If there's mutual interest, they sign the apartment contract. If not, the process rejoins with those who are trying to get an apartment on their own. After getting an apartment, through the tool or on their own, they upload the apartment contract.  After uploading either the work contract and insurance documents (for those with job agreements), or after providing the job and residence info based on RWR regulations and uploading an apartment contract if available, the user sends (or reapplies for) the RWR card.  After the RWR application is sent, the process waits for 2 years. Then the user decides whether they want to renew.  If yes, the process loops back to providing information for the job/venture. If not, the process ends with the status "RWR card irrelevant".  Alternatively, if the apartment search hasn't worked out, either independently or via the tool, the process loops back to making a plan about how to get an apartment.  Finally, if they are not trying to get an apartment on their own, the process converges to uploading the apartment contract and proceeds to applying for an RWR card. If at any point the process doesn't work out to get an apartment, the process ends with "ended with no success".

tasks.name: Make a Plan to Get an Apartment
Upload Form and Attach Bank Approval

0.text: The process starts when someone decides to participate in a night run. First, they select a starting block. Then, they run 5 km and simultaneously start measuring time. When the run is over, the time measurement is stopped. The total running time is then calculated.  Based on whether the running time is less than 25 minutes, the participant either does additional training or continues the process. If satisfied with the result, they get their starting number. Next, based on their workday schedule, they either go to the run from home or go directly after work.  Finally, they run the night run, drink an isotonic sports drink, receive their final running time and finish the run.

tasks.name: Go to the run from home

1.text: The process starts with the desire to participate in a night run.  A starting block is selected, after which the runner runs 5 km and starts measuring time concurrently.  When the run is finished, the time measurement is stopped.  The total running time is then calculated. Based on the running time, the runner decides whether they are satisfied with the result. If satisfied, the runner gets their starting number.  If not satisfied, more training is performed, after which the runner again selects a starting block and repeats the process of running and time measurement. Once the starting number is acquired, it is determined whether the workday ends more than 1 hour before the starting time.  If so, the runner goes to the run from home.  If not, the runner goes directly to the run after work. Regardless of how the runner gets to the run, they then run the night run and drink an isotonic sports drink concurrently. Finally, the runner receives their final running time, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Go Directly to Run After Work

events.name: Desire to Participate in Night Run

gateways.name: Workday Ends More Than 1 Hour Before Starting Time?

2.text: The process starts with the desire to participate in a night run.  A starting block is selected, after which the 5 km run and the time measurement are started in parallel. When the run is finished, the time measurement is stopped.  The total running time is then retrieved. Next, it is evaluated whether the runner took less than 25 minutes. If so, the runner is satisfied with the result. If not, further training is done, after which the starting block selection process is repeated. If the runner is satisfied, the starting number is retrieved. After receiving the starting number, it is checked whether the workday ends more than 1 hour before the starting time. If so, the participant will go to the run from home. If not, the participant will go directly to the run after work. Regardless of whether the participant went to the run from home or directly after work, the night run is performed and iso sport is drunk afterwards, in parallel. Finally, the final running time is received and the run is finished.

0.text: The process starts with connecting to the management system, followed by reading the order from the system.  Next, the process checks if it is the first order in stock. If yes, the warehouse is browsed, and the product is withdrawn.  If no, the wholesaler is contacted, who then reorders from the wholesaler. Regardless of whether the product was in stock initially, the next step involves checking the arrival of the product. If the arrival takes more than 10 days, a delivery delay penalty is applied from the wholesaler. If the arrival is within 10 days, or after the penalty is applied, the user gives the OK for the arrived product.  The product is then registered in the management system. Subsequently, the process checks if the order is ready for shipment.  If yes, the product is packed and, in parallel, a courier is requested. After packing and the courier request are complete, the delivery is shipped, and the process ends with a successful delivery. If the order is not ready for shipment, the order details are read again from the system, and the process loops back to the stock check.

1.text: The process starts when a user connects to the management system. The first step is to read the order from the system. Next, the process checks if the ordered product is in stock. If it is, the product is withdrawn from the warehouse, and then reordered from the wholesaler. If the product is not in stock, the user contacts the wholesaler, who then reorders the product.  After the product has been reordered, whether initially in stock or not, the process waits for arrival of the product.  If the arrival takes more than 10 days, a delivery delay penalty is applied from the wholesaler. Regardless of whether a penalty is applied, or if the arrival time is within 10 days, the user gives the OK for the arrived product. The product is then registered in the management system. The process then checks if the delivery is ready to be shipped. If not, the process loops back to read the order from the system. If the delivery is ready, the product is packed by the user, and, in parallel, a courier is requested and the product is shipped. Once shipped, the process ends with a successful delivery.

2.text: The process starts when a user connects to the management system to read an order.  The system then checks if it is the first order in stock. If it is, the system browses the warehouse and withdraws the product.  If the product is not in stock, the user contacts the wholesaler to reorder the product. The wholesaler reorders the product and the process waits for the product to arrive. If the arrival takes more than 10 days, the system applies a delivery delay penalty from the wholesaler. Regardless of whether a penalty is applied, the system then checks the arrived product. After giving the ok for the arrived product, the system registers the product in the management system.  Concurrently, after reading the order, the user requests a courier and packs the product. Once the product is registered, the system checks if it's ready for shipment. If ready, the packed product and the requested courier are used to ship the delivery, after which the process ends with successful delivery. If not ready for shipment, the system reads the order again.

0.text: The process starts when the customer selects the properties of a chainsaw and sends the order to the manufacturer. The manufacturer receives and analyzes the order.  Concurrently, the manufacturer starts checking with suppliers if all parts are available and orders the parts from the suppliers. Parts are received from the suppliers. The manufacturer checks if all parts have been received. If all parts have been received, a manual inspection is performed. Otherwise, the manufacturer continues to check with suppliers for the missing parts, ordering parts as they become available. After the manual inspection, the chainsaw is assembled. While the chainsaw is being assembled and while progress is being monitored, regular updates are sent to the customer. After assembly, the first product is sent to the customer and feedback is received.  The manufacturer checks the feedback. If improvements are needed, the product is improved and the first product is resent to the customer to receive updated feedback.  If no improvements are needed, the manufacturer produces the rest of the customer's order while monitoring production progress, sending regular updates to the customer on the production status. Once the complete order is produced, it is sent to the customer.  Once the customer receives their complete order, the process ends.

1.text: The process starts when the customer selects the properties of a chainsaw and sends this selection to the manufacturer. The manufacturer receives and analyzes the order and orders parts from the suppliers.  The manufacturer also begins checking with suppliers and receiving parts. When checking with suppliers, the manufacturer sends a message to the suppliers. The suppliers, in response, send the parts to the manufacturer who receives them. This cycle of checking with suppliers and receiving parts continues until all parts have been received.  If all parts are received, the manufacturer performs a manual inspection.  If parts are still outstanding, the manufacturer continues to check with suppliers. After manual inspection, the manufacturer assembles the chainsaw, sending regular updates to the customer during assembly.  After assembly, the manufacturer sends the first product to the customer and receives feedback. Based on the feedback, the manufacturer decides whether to improve the product. If improvements are needed, the product is improved and the first product is sent to the customer again. This loop continues until the customer is satisfied. Once the feedback indicates no further improvements are needed, the manufacturer monitors the progress of producing the rest of the order and concurrently produces the rest of the order.  The manufacturer sends regular updates to the customer while monitoring this progress.  Once both monitoring and production of the rest of the order are complete, the manufacturer sends the complete order to the customer. The customer receives the order, marking the end of the process.

2.text: The process starts when the customer selects the properties of a chainsaw and sends this selection to the manufacturer. The manufacturer receives and analyzes the order.  The manufacturer then orders parts from the suppliers. The manufacturer then checks with the suppliers if all parts have been received. If not, the manufacturer will continue to receive parts from the suppliers. Once all parts are received, a manual inspection is performed by the manufacturer. The manufacturer continues assembling the chainsaw and sends the first product to the customer, while simultaneously sending regular updates to the customer about the chainsaw assembly progress. The manufacturer receives feedback from the customer. The manufacturer then decides whether to improve the product or not. If the manufacturer chooses to improve the product, the first product will be sent back for improvements, and subsequently sent to the customer. Regardless of product improvement, the manufacturer proceeds to monitor the progress and produce the rest of the order. Once the production is complete and the progress monitoring is done, the manufacturer sends the complete order to the customer. The customer receives the order, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Monitor Progress & Produce Rest of Order

0.text: The process starts with the task "Build machine". First, a basic design is developed, followed by ordering the necessary Lego brick sets.  The Lego bricks are then sorted according to size, which leads to putting the big, medium, and small bricks into suitable containers simultaneously.  Once the big bricks are containerized, the process checks if a container is empty. If yes, more Lego bricks are reordered. If not, or after reordering, building subcomponents begins.  This step is followed by a check if this building process was successful.  If not, the subcomponent is redesigned and the building process starts over. This loop continues until the subcomponents are built successfully. Parallel to building the subcomponents and putting bricks into their containers, additional subcomponents are built.  After building the first set of subcomponents and putting the medium, and small bricks into containers, the subcomponents are tested.  If successful, the subcomponents are assembled to the machine, and the process ends with "Finish machine". If not successful, more bricks are reordered.  This cycle continues until successful.

1.text: The process starts with the task "Build machine". First, a basic design is developed, followed by ordering the necessary Lego brick sets.  The Lego bricks are then sorted according to size. Next, subcomponents are built. The process checks if a container is empty. If it is not, more subcomponents are built. If the container *is* empty, Lego bricks are reordered. The reordered bricks, along with the existing subcomponents, trigger another task to continue building further subcomponents. Subsequently, the subcomponents are tested. If the test is successful, the subcomponents are assembled to the machine and the process ends with "Finish machine". If the test is not successful, the subcomponent is redesigned. Meanwhile, after sorting the Lego bricks, they are also put into suitable containers in parallel, by size (big, medium, and small). Once all bricks of each size are placed in their containers, the process converges and subcomponents are built.  If the subcomponent redesign is required, the redesigned subcomponent is also used for building the final subcomponents.

2.text: The process starts with the task "Build machine". First, a basic design is developed, followed by ordering the necessary Lego brick sets.  The Lego bricks are then sorted according to size. Next, subcomponents are built.  The process checks if containers are empty. If they are not, building of subcomponents continues.  If the containers are empty, Lego bricks are reordered. When building subcomponents is finished, the subcomponents are tested.  If the test is successful, the subcomponents are assembled to the machine and the process ends with "Finish machine". If the test is not successful, the subcomponent is redesigned and the building of subcomponents is continued.  Concurrent to building the subcomponents, after sorting the bricks, big, medium and small bricks are put in suitable containers. After all bricks are put in their respective containers, the process continues with building the subcomponents.

tasks.name: Sort Lego bricks according to size

0.text: The process starts with sending invitations for friends.  The admin then asks which games they want to play, receives the list of games and chooses which games will be played. Then the admin downloads any missing games. If there are missing games, the admin asks how much beer they want to drink. Afterwards, the admin receives an estimation of the total amount of beer required and checks if it is enough. If it's enough, preparations for the LAN party begin. If not, the admin goes to the supermarket to buy the missing beer, and then prepares for the LAN party. After the preparations, the LAN party takes place and the process ends.  Concurrently to the process described above, after choosing which games will be played, two parallel subprocesses start. The admin asks the guests whether they want all the chosen games or not. If not, the admin changes the chosen games and repeats the question. If yes, the parallel gateway synchronizes and the admin appoints a date for the LAN party and sends out requests. If eight more people are allowed on this date, this parallel gateway synchronizes. If not, the date is changed and the admin appoints a new date, repeating the process.

1.text: The process starts with sending invitations for friends.  The admin then asks the friends which games they want to play and receives a list of games in return.  The admin then chooses games and this triggers a parallel gateway where simultaneously the admin asks guests which games do they want and appoints a date for the LAN party and sends out the request.  The response from the guest games question goes to an exclusive gateway to check if all guests want the same games. If yes, this path merges with another path at a parallel gateway.  If not, the admin changes the guest games and asks the guests about the games again.  The date request path flows to an exclusive gateway to determine if 8 more people are allowed on that date. If yes, this path also merges with the previous at the parallel gateway. If not, the admin changes the date and restarts the date request process.   At the parallel gateway, the admin asks how much beer the guests want to drink, receives the estimated number of beers required, and checks if there is enough beer. Simultaneously, there is a check for missing games. If games are missing, the admin downloads them and goes back to the beer question subroutine. If not, this path merges with the beer amount check. If there is not enough beer, the admin goes to the supermarket to buy the missing beer and then prepares for the LAN party. If there is enough beer, the admin prepares for the LAN party.  Finally, the process ends with having a LAN party.

2.text: The process starts with sending invitations for friends to the LAN party.  The admin then asks the server which games they want to play. Once the admin receives the list of games, they choose which games will be played at the LAN party.  Concurrently, the admin appoints a date for the LAN party and asks guests if the date works for 8 more people. If the date does not work, the admin changes the date and appoints a new date. If the appointed date works, the admin proceeds to ask the guests which games they want to play.  The admin then asks if the current selection of games is sufficient. Concurrently, the admin asks the guests how much beer they want to drink. The admin then receives an estimated number of beers required for the party. If there are not enough beers, the admin goes to the supermarket and buys the missing beer. If there are enough beers, the process proceeds. After buying the missing beer, or if there are enough beers, the admin prepares for the LAN party. If there are any missing games, the admin downloads them. Afterwards or if there are no missing games, the admin asks the guests if all their game requests are fulfilled. If the guests want more games, the admin again asks the guests how much beer they would like to drink, and the process loops back to calculating the beer requirements. If all game requests are fulfilled, the process proceeds. If all the date accommodations and game selections are finalized, and the LAN party preparations are complete, the LAN party takes place, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Ask guests which games they want to play
Appoint a date for LAN party
Ask guests which games they want to play
Ask if current game selection is sufficient
Ask guests how much beer they want
Go to supermarket and buy beer
Ask guests if game requests are fulfilled

0.text: The process starts in the Police App when a successful service occurs. After a timer event, the app checks if the car is still registered. If the car is registered, the app notifies the car owner via a message, and then checks if the car has been brought to a mechanic. If the car has not arrived at the mechanic after a timer event, the app fines the car owner (sending them a notification message) and the process ends for the Police App.  If the car has arrived, the process continues in the Police App. The car owner can react to the app notification. If they choose to bring the car to service, a message is sent to the mechanic to signal that the car has arrived. The car owner then waits for the car to be repaired and concurrently receives status updates.  Another timer triggers the car owner to either pay the mechanic via the app (message is sent to the Police app), or they pay cash/by card. After paying, the car owner receives the "Pickerl" (confirmation of car in good condition) and the process ends for the car owner. The mechanic starts their part of the process when the car arrives. The mechanic checks the car and enters any found car problems which are sent as a message to the police app. The mechanic then enters the car problems and in parallel sends updates and repairs the car. Concurrently, the Police App receives the car problems. If the car owner does not react to the app notification, the owner receives the fine and this part of the process ends for the car owner. When the mechanic finished repairing, sending updates and receiving the payment for the car repair, the payment amount is determined, which triggers a decision in the Police App whether a payment via app is possible. If yes, the money is transferred to the mechanic, and the mechanic confirms successful repair (message to Police App). If no, then also the repair success is confirmed to the Police App. The mechanic then provides the customer with the Pickerl (message to car owner) and enters the time for the next service, which is sent to the Police App, after which the process ends for the mechanic. The Police App receives the confirmation of successful repair and waits for the time for the next service. After receiving the next service time, the process ends for the Police App.

1.text:
The process starts in the Police App when a successful service occurs. After a timer event, the app checks if the car is still registered. If the car is registered, the app notifies the car owner via a message, and then checks if the car has been brought to a mechanic. If the car has not been brought to the mechanic, a timer event triggers, and the app fines the car owner (sending a message to the car owner). If the car is not registered, the process ends.  If the car has been brought to the mechanic, the process checks if the car has arrived at the mechanic's shop.

The car owner process starts when they receive a notification from the app.  The owner can choose to bring the car to the service or ignore the notification. If they ignore the notification, they will receive the fine, and the process ends for them. If they bring the car to the service (sending a message to the mechanic), they will wait for the car to be repaired, simultaneously receiving status updates. A timer event can occur while waiting. After receiving updates and/or after the timer event, the car owner can pay via the app (sending a message to the Police App) or pay cash/by card (sending a message to the mechanic). After paying, the car owner receives their "Pickerl" (a sticker indicating roadworthiness) and the process ends for them.

The mechanic process begins when a car arrives. The mechanic checks the car and enters the car problems, then sending a message to the Police App with the car problems. Then, the mechanic simultaneously sends status updates and repairs the car. After sending updates, the mechanic determines the payment amount, and offers payment to the car owner via a message.  After the car is repaired, the status update process is finished. Once the mechanic receives payment, either via the app or cash/card, they enter that the repair was successful, provide the customer with the Pickerl (sending a message to the car owner), and enter the time for the next service. After providing the Pickerl, and receiving the next service time, this process ends.


Back in the Police App process, if the check for car arrival is positive, the app receives car problems (sent from the mechanic). If the check is negative, a timer is triggered, and the police app fines the car owner, subsequently ending the process. After receiving car problems, the Police App offers payment to the car owner. Depending on the payment method, the app either transfers the payment to the mechanic (if paid via app), or waits for confirmation of successful repair (if another payment method is chosen). In both cases, after the payment is handled or confirmation is received, the Police App receives the time for the next service and the process ends.  If the car owner paid via the app, the successful repair triggers the confirmation in the police app.

tasks.name: Check if car has been brought to mechanic
Wait for confirmation of successful repair
Send car problems to Police App

2.text:
The process starts in the Police App when a successful service occurs. After a timer event, the app checks if the car is still registered. If the car is registered, the app notifies the car owner via a message, and then checks if the car has been brought to a mechanic.  If the car owner receives the notification, they can choose to either bring the car to service, or ignore the notification. Bringing the car to service sends a message to the mechanic, and triggers a parallel process of waiting for the car to be repaired, and receiving status updates. If the owner ignores the notification, it triggers the Police app to send a fine via message, which the car owner receives. The fine ends the process for the car owner.

Meanwhile, the mechanic process starts when a car arrives.  The mechanic checks the car, enters the car problems, and sends the problems as a message to the Police App. In parallel, the mechanic begins repairing the car and sends status updates via message to the car owner.  The Police App receives the car problems, and determines and offers a payment amount to the car owner via message. The mechanic finishes repairing the car and triggers status updates, and then determines the payment amount. The status updates and timer event for the car owner trigger a decision on how to pay. The car owner can pay via the app (sending a message to the police app), or pay by cash or card, sending a message to the mechanic. Receiving payment triggers the mechanic to enter that the repair succeeded and provide the car owner with the "Pickerl" via message, ending the car owner process.

Back in the Police App, after offering a payment amount, if the payment was made via the app, the app transfers the payment to the mechanic, receives confirmation of successful repair via message, receives time for the next service, and the process ends. If the payment method is "other", the Police App receives confirmation and time for next service, then ends. If the car was not brought to the mechanic after notification, a timer event triggers a fine and the process for the Police App ends. If the car was not registered, the process ends immediately for the Police app.  If the car does arrive after the initial check, the mechanic receives car problems and the process continues as described above.

0.text: The inspection process starts when the inspector enters the type of machine and serial number.  This information is sent to the application. The application receives the type and serial number and checks them.  Based on the check, the application queries relevant questions and sends them to the service task.  Simultaneously, the inspector hits next. Depending on the outcome of the application's check, the process diverges. If the check is negative, the application queries relevant questions, then asks the inspector those questions. The inspector answers the questions, and this triggers the "Hit next" action. Regardless of whether additional questions were asked or not, this triggers a service task that autofills values relevant to the machine, which are then shown to the inspector for review. The inspector then confirms the values, sending them to the application. The application receives the confirmed values and checks them. If the check is positive, the inspection is finished, which triggers a corresponding service task in the application, and the process ends for both the inspector and the application. If the application's check of the confirmed values is negative, the process loops back and the application queries relevant questions again. The inspector receives these questions, answers them again, and continues with the process of autofilling values, reviewing, and confirming until the application's check is positive.

tasks.name: Enter Machine Type and Serial Number

1.text: The inspection process starts when the inspector enters the type of machine and serial number.  This information is sent to the application, which receives the type and serial number.  The inspector then proceeds to answer provided questions. Concurrently, the application checks if these values are present. Based on the check, the application either queries relevant questions, or autofills values relevant to the machine and shows them to the inspector. If questions are queried by the application, it will ask the inspector these questions who subsequently answers them. This information is sent to the application, which in turn uses it to autofill values relevant to the machine and show these values to the inspector.  The inspector checks the shown values and after confirming them, sends the confirmed values to the application. The application evaluates if the inspection is finished. If the inspection is not finished, the application proceeds to query relevant questions which starts a new cycle. If the inspection is finished, the application emits inspection done, and the inspector finishes the inspection which marks the end of the process.

tasks.name: Enter Machine Type and Serial Number

2.text: The inspection process starts when the inspector enters the type of machine and serial number.  This information is sent to the application, which receives the type and serial number. The inspector then proceeds to answer questions provided by the application.  Meanwhile, the application checks if more questions are needed based on the received machine information. If more questions are needed, the application queries relevant questions and asks them to the inspector. This loop continues until no further questions are required. Once all questions have been answered, the inspector hits next, prompting the application to autofill values relevant to the machine. These values are shown to the inspector, who then checks them. Following this, the inspector confirms the values, sending them to the application. The application receives the confirmed values and checks if they are correct. If not, the process loops back to requesting more questions from the inspector. If the values are correct, the inspector finishes the inspection, and the application marks the inspection as done, concluding the process.

tasks.name: Enter machine type and serial number

0.text: The process starts with the manufacturer receiving a customized airplane order from the customer.  The manufacturer then starts processing the order and simultaneously builds the airplane base model and transmits the customization requirements to the responsible teams. Once the base model is built and the requirements are transmitted, a timer is started for 14 days.  Meanwhile, the manufacturer installs the individual bits and pieces in the airplane.  If the requirements are not met within the 14 days, the manufacturer sends a reminder to the responsible teams and restarts the 14-day timer.  Once the requirements are met, the manufacturer continues and controls the engines and risk factors. Once the checks are complete, the plane is prepared for a test flight. The test pilot then conducts the test flight and sends a test flight protocol to the manufacturer.  The manufacturer automatically forwards the protocol to the customer. Based on the customer type, the manufacturer either ships the plane via premium shipping to the premium customer or standard shipping to regular customers. Finally, the manufacturer receives confirmation via email from the customer, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with the manufacturer receiving a customized airplane order from the customer.  The manufacturer then starts processing the order and simultaneously builds the airplane base model and transmits the customization requirements to the responsible teams. Once the base model is built and the requirements are transmitted, a parallel gateway synchronizes these two paths. After transmitting the requirements, the manufacturer also sends a message to the responsible team. Concurrently, after building the airplane base model, the process checks if the requirements are met. If not, a reminder is sent to the responsible teams via message, after which a 14-day timer starts. Once the 14 days are up, the check if requirements are met is performed again. This loop continues until the requirements are met. If the requirements are met, the manufacturer installs the individual bits and pieces in the airplane. Regardless of whether a reminder was sent or not, 14-day timer events converge at this requirement check. Once the parts are installed, the manufacturer prepares the plane for a test flight. The test pilot then performs the test flight and sends a test flight protocol back to the manufacturer. The manufacturer automatically forwards the test flight protocol to the customer via message. Based on the customer type, either premium or standard shipping to the customer is initiated. After shipping, the manufacturer waits for an e-mail confirmation from the customer. Upon receiving the confirmation, the process ends.

2.text: The process starts with the manufacturer receiving a customized airplane order from the customer.  The order is being processed and then the manufacturer builds the airplane base model and transmits the customization requirements to the responsible teams. These two actions happen in parallel. Once both tasks are complete, the manufacturer will wait for 14 days. Also, the manufacturer installs the individual bits and pieces in the airplane. Once this task is finished, the manufacturer controls the engines and risk factors. Independently from that, after the 14 day timer event, the manufacturer checks if the requirements are met. If the requirements are not met, the manufacturer sends a reminder to the responsible team and waits another 14 days before checking the requirements again. This loop continues until the requirements are met.  Once the requirements are met, the manufacturer prepares the plane for a test flight. The test pilot then performs the test flight and sends a test flight protocol to the manufacturer.  The manufacturer automatically forwards the test flight protocol to the customer. Based on whether the customer is a premium customer or not, the manufacturer either ships the airplane via premium shipping or standard shipping. Finally, the manufacturer receives confirmation via email from the customer, which ends the process.

0.text: The process starts when a customer gives an order to a robot. The robot asks the customer if they want only a burger or a menu. The customer then tells the robot whether they want a burger or a menu.  If the customer wants a menu, the robot will ask the customer whether they want wedges or fries. Concurrently, the robot prepares a drink. The customer then tells the robot whether they want wedges or fries. If the customer wants fries, the robot prepares fries. If the customer wants wedges, the robot prepares wedges. Once the fries are prepared, the robot waits. Once the wedges are prepared, the robot waits. Once the drink is prepared, the robot waits. After the fries, wedges, and drink are finished, the robot prepares the burger. Concurrently the robot gives enthusiastic status updates to the customer, who listens to the updates. The robot will continue to give updates if the burger is not ready.  When the burger is prepared the robot puts the order on a conveyor belt. The customer takes the order from the conveyor belt, and the process ends for both the customer and the robot. If the customer initially ordered only a burger, the robot prepares a burger and gives enthusiastic updates to the customer who listens to the updates.  When the burger is ready the robot puts the order on the conveyor belt, and the customer takes the order from the conveyor belt ending the process.

1.text: The process starts when a customer gives an order to a robot. The robot asks the customer if they want only a burger or a menu.  The customer then tells the robot whether they want a burger or a menu. If the customer wants a menu, the robot will prepare a drink and ask the customer whether they want wedges or fries. Concurrently, the customer will tell the robot whether they want wedges or fries. If the customer wants fries, the robot prepares fries. If the customer wants wedges, the robot will prepare wedges. The robot will wait for the fries or wedges to be prepared and in parallel will wait for the drink to be prepared. Once both are ready, the robot prepares the burger. If the customer only wants a burger, the robot will prepare the burger immediately. While the burger is being prepared, the robot gives enthusiastic status updates to the customer, who listens to them. The robot continues giving updates until the burger is prepared.  Once the burger is prepared, the robot puts the order on a conveyor belt. The customer takes the order from the conveyor belt, and the process ends for both the robot and customer.

2.text: The process starts when a customer gives an order to the robot. The robot asks the customer if they want only a burger or a menu. The customer then tells the robot whether they want a burger or a menu. If the customer wants a menu, the robot prepares a drink and asks the customer whether they want wedges or fries. Concurrently, the customer tells the robot whether they want wedges or fries. If the customer wants fries, the robot prepares fries. If the customer wants wedges, the robot prepares wedges. After preparing the fries or wedges, the robot prepares the burger. While the burger is being prepared, the robot gives enthusiastic status updates to the customer, who listens to these updates. Once the burger is prepared, the robot puts the order on a conveyor belt. The customer then takes the order from the conveyor belt, and the process ends. If the customer initially ordered only a burger, the robot prepares the burger and, at the same time, gives enthusiastic status updates to the customer, who listens to the updates. After the burger is prepared, the robot puts the order on the conveyor belt. The customer takes the order from the conveyor belt, and the process ends.

0.text: The Farming Bot Game starts when a player has the desire to create a farming bot. The player first figures out the wanted resources and then checks the repo for already available resources while simultaneously collecting urgently needed resources. The check for available resources is followed by a decision on whether new tools are needed. If new tools are needed, the player builds them. If not, the player proceeds.  Meanwhile, after the player collects the urgently needed resources and also completes their tool creation if necessary, the player will collect any remaining resources. These feed into a parallel path where the player updates the resource list and also initiates farming with the bot. Upon initiating, the bot checks whether a random natural event (RNE) happened and resets accordingly or continues farming. In parallel to this, the bot sends a notification to the player who subsequently reads the message. The notification leads the player to check if a new milestone is achieved. If a new milestone is achieved, the bot will notify the player; if not, the player proceeds.  After farming, the bot checks if it has finished based on the read message. If finished, the bot checks whether to either brag to friends, ask friends for help with materials, or both. Bragging leads to the player bragging to friends. A request for help from friends leads to them helping with materials. These ultimately feed into a parallel gateway where the updated list of resources or received materials from friends are considered. Finally, the process ends. If the bot did not finish farming, it gives itself a sleeping break and waits for an RNE. After waiting, the process continues to trigger the bot to start farming.

tasks.name: Ask friends for help with materials

1.text: The process starts when a player in the Farming Bot Game has the desire to create a farming bot.  The player first figures out the wanted resources and then concurrently checks the repo for already available resources and collects urgently needed resources.
