Once the resources are collected, the process splits to check if new tools are needed. If so, the player builds the tools.  Regardless of whether new tools are built, the player collects any remaining resources.  Meanwhile, after checking the repo, the player also reads any messages from the bot.  The bot concurrently starts farming and the player checks if the bot is finished. If not, the bot continues farming and the player checks for a new milestone. If a new milestone is achieved, the bot notifies the player, who then reads the message. If no new milestone is achieved, the bot continues farming. This loop continues until the bot is finished. Once finished, the player can choose to brag to friends or help with materials (or both). Concurrently, the player updates the list of resources. Finally, the process ends.  If the bot is not finished farming, and after it starts farming, it checks if a random natural event (RNE) happened.  If an RNE happened the bot resets; otherwise, it continues farming. Also, when the player helps with materials and brags to friends, these actions are joined to update the resource list and ultimately end the process.  The player gives the bot a sleeping break if it is not finished. The bot waits for an RNE after collecting remaining resources.

tasks.name: Check if new tools are needed

2.text: The Farming Bot Game process starts when a player has the desire to create a farming bot. The player first figures out the wanted resources and then begins two parallel actions: collecting urgently needed resources and checking the repository for already available resources.  Once the readily available resources are identified, the player checks if new tools are needed. If so, the player builds the tools.  Regardless of whether new tools were built or not, the player collects any remaining resources. These collection tasks synchronize before flowing into farming actions. At the same time, the player receives notifications from the bot and reads messages. Based on the message content, the bot might finish its work or continue operating. If the bot is finished, the player decides whether to brag to friends or help them with materials. Both options can occur concurrently. Meanwhile, the farming bot starts farming. After a round of farming, the bot checks for a new milestone. If achieved, the bot notifies the player, who then reads the message and restarts the process. If no milestone is reached, the bot continues farming and checks again. Concurrently, after collecting the remaining resources, the bot waits for a random natural event.  If the event occurs, the bot resets; otherwise, it continues farming.  After waiting for the event or resetting the bot, the bot updates its resource list. This update, combined with any bragging or helping from the player (if the bot has finished), signifies the end of the process.  If the bot isn't finished after reading the message, it either gives itself a sleeping break or continues farming. If a break is taken, the bot will wait for random natural event after.

tasks.name: Check if new tools are needed

0.text: The process starts with loading the front page of the Internship Software.  The topic, payment, experience, and hobbies information are gathered in parallel.  This information is then used to send a request to the company.  Meanwhile, the Internship Software waits until an offer arrives from the company.  When an offer is received, the user is asked whether they accept the offer. If they do not accept the offer, the process loops back to loading the front page. If they do accept the offer, all other offers become invalid, triggering weekly status updates being sent to the company.  The Internship Software also receives status updates from the company. Once a status update is received, the software waits until the internship is finished. After the internship is finished, the user is asked if they would recommend the company to their friends. If not, the process ends. If they do recommend the company, they then tweet to their friends about the company, and the process ends.

1.text: The process starts with loading the front page within the Internship Software.  Then, concurrently, the topic, payment, experience and hobbies are handled by the user.  Once the topic, payment, experience and hobbies are completed, a request is sent to the company. The software then waits until an offer arrives from the company.  When an offer is received, the user is asked to accept the offer or not. If the offer is rejected, the process loops back to loading the front page. If the offer is accepted, all other offers become invalid and the Internship Software sends status updates every week to the company.  The user concurrently receives status updates from the company.  After receiving a status update, the software waits until the internship is finished. The user is then asked whether to recommend the company to friends.  If not, the process ends. If yes, the user tweets to their friends about the company, and the process ends.

2.text: The process begins with loading the front page of the Internship Software, followed by providing input on the topic, payment, experience, and hobbies in parallel.  This information is then sent as a request to the company.  Meanwhile, the software waits until an offer arrives from the company.  Upon receiving an offer, the internship software checks if the user accepts the offer. If the offer is rejected, the process loops back to loading the front page. If accepted, all other offers become invalid, triggering weekly status updates to the company and also status update is recieved back from the company. After the internship is finished (indicated by a timer event), the software prompts whether to recommend the company.  If yes, the user tweets about the company to their friends, leading to the process end. If no, the process ends immediately.

0.text: The process starts with creating a list of necessary parts. Then, webshops are queried for the necessary parts, and the shop with the cheapest parts is chosen.  The next step is to make an order to the chosen webshop. Upon receiving the order, the webshop proceeds with two parallel actions: sending an invoice and delivering the order. Additionally, the webshop updates its inventory. After the invoice is sent, the manufacturer receives the order and starts building.  Meanwhile, after the order is delivered, it is checked if the stock is greater than 5. If yes, the project is finished, and the process ends. If the stock is not greater than 5, it is checked if the stock is equal to 0. If yes, a compliment email is written, after which the project is finished and the process ends. If the stock is not equal to 0, it is checked if the stock is less than 3. If yes, the part with faster delivery is ordered.  If the stock is not less than 3, but less than 5, the cheapest part is ordered. After ordering either the cheapest or the fastest delivery part, the webshop receives the order and the subsequent steps are repeated as described earlier.

1.text: The process starts with creating a list of necessary parts.  Next, webshops are queried for the necessary parts, and the shop with the cheapest parts is chosen.  An order is then made to the chosen webshop. The webshop receives the order and, in parallel, sends an invoice, delivers the order and updates its inventory.  The manufacturer also receives the order and starts building. After the manufacturer receives the order and begins building, a check is performed to see if the stock is greater than 5. If yes, the project is finished and the process ends.  If the stock is not greater than 5, there is a check to see if the stock is equal to 0. If yes, a compliment email is written. If the stock is not equal to 0, there is a check to see if the stock is less than 3. If yes, the part with faster delivery is ordered. If not, a check is made if stock is less than 5. If yes, the cheapest part is ordered.  If not, a compliment email is written. Regardless of whether the cheapest part or the part with faster delivery is ordered, the process converges to the webshop receiving an order and the process flows as described previously to finish the project, thus ending the process.

2.text: The process starts with creating a list of necessary parts. Then, webshops are queried for the necessary parts, and the shop with the cheapest parts is chosen.  Next, an order is made to the webshop. The order process branches: the webshop receives the order, which triggers parallel paths. The first path involves the webshop sending an invoice, delivering the order, and updating its inventory. The second path starts when the manufacturer receives the order and begins building.  After the manufacturer completes the build, the process checks if stock is greater than 5. If yes, the process proceeds. If no, it checks if the stock is equal to 0. If yes, a compliment email is written, and the process merges back to the main flow. If the stock is not equal to 0, it checks if it is less than 3. If yes, the part with the fastest delivery is ordered. If no, it checks if stock is less than 5. If yes, the cheapest part is ordered. If no, it re-evaluates whether the stock is greater than 5. This check loops back until the condition of 'stock > 5?' returns 'yes'.  Regardless of how the parts are ordered, the order process eventually reaches a point where the project is finished, thus concluding the process.

0.text: The process starts when applying for maternity leave. The applicant must determine whether they are self-employed/studying/housewife/man or employed. If self-employed/studying/housewife/man, the process ends, noting that maternity leave is possible but without payment. If employed, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company. After receiving employer confirmation, the applicant can take maternity leave. Afterward, the applicant decides whether to split or extend the maternity leave. If splitting, the process continues to evaluate the leave duration. If extending, it also goes to the evaluation of leave duration. If the maternity leave is less than 2 months, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company and awaits the employer's confirmation. If the maternity leave is more than 3 months, the applicant sends another employer notification to the company and also waits for confirmation. When the employer's confirmation is received for either duration, the applicant can take maternity leave, and the process ends. If the applicant chose to split, they might also choose to have both parents take maternity leave. If both parents take maternity leave and confirm the baby is younger than 2 years and confirm their parental status, then it is determined whether they are self-employed or employed, restarting part of the process. If both parents do not take maternity leave, the process ends, indicating it is not possible.

tasks.name: Confirm baby's age and parental status

1.text: The process for maternity leave application starts.  There is a parallel gateway splitting the flow to check if the baby is younger than 2 years and if it's the parent who is applying. Both checks are joined by a parallel gateway that leads to a decision gateway "Self-employed or employed?". If self-employed/studying/housewife/man, the process ends with maternity leave possible, but without payment. If employed, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company. After the company sends confirmation back to the applicant, the applicant can take maternity leave. Subsequently, there is a decision gateway, giving the options to split, extend or neither. If the applicant chooses to split or extend the maternity leave, a further decision gateway checks if the maternity leave is less than 2 months or more than 3 months. If less than 2 months, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company and continues in the flow, as if the maternity leave would be more than 3 months. If more than 3 months, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company. Both paths are joined by a parallel gateway which leads to receiving the employer notification from the company. The applicant can now take maternity leave, which marks the end of the process. If, in the previous decision gateway, neither splitting or extending was chosen, the process continues after receiving confirmation from the company (after the initial application).  If the applicant chooses to split the leave, there is a decision: "Both parents take maternity leave?". If yes, the process ends as not possible.

events.name: Maternity leave possible, but without payment

gateways.name: Less than 2 months or more than 3 months?

2.text: The process for maternity leave application starts. The process considers whether the applicant is self-employed/studying/housewife/man or employed. If self-employed/studying/housewife/man, the process ends with the notification that maternity leave is possible but without payment. If employed, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company and waits to receive employer confirmation. After receiving confirmation, the applicant can take maternity leave.  The applicant can then decide to either split the maternity leave, extend it, or both split and extend it. If split, the process goes on to verify if the leave is less than 2 months or more than 3 months. If less than 2 months, the applicant sends an employer notification to the company, then waits for employer confirmation. If more than 3 months, the applicant also sends an employer notification to the company and then waits for confirmation.  Once the employer confirmation is received, the applicant takes the maternity leave, and the process ends. When an extension is chosen, an additional possibility is for both parents to take maternity leave, in which case the process ends as not possible. If extending maternity leave and it is agreed, the same check occurs to see if the leave is less than 2 months or more than 3 months and proceeds as described before.  In parallel, the process also checks if the baby is younger than 2 years old and if the applicant is a parent. Both these paths converge and then progress to determining if the applicant is self-employed or employed, starting that part of the process again.

0.text: The process starts when a customer sends their fridge symptoms and type to the central fridge service center. The central fridge service center receives the report and selects a local service facility.  Simultaneously, the central service center receives the report and the customer makes an appointment with the local service facility.  The local service facility receives the request for an appointment time and sends a message to the customer to make an appointment. The customer then requests an appointment time which starts a timer event at the local facility. The local facility checks the fridge. The customer confirms if the fridge is OK. If the customer confirms the fridge is OK, the local facility sends a confirmation to the central service center, concluding the process for the local facility. The customer then rates the facility and the central service center receives the facility rating, ending the entire process. If the customer does not confirm the fridge is OK, they check the fridge and give feedback if it is ok.  If the fridge is not OK after the check, the local service facility makes repairs. After the repairs, the customer is asked if the fridge is repaired. If yes, a conditional event triggers and the local service facility sends a fridge ok message which is received by the central service center and ends the local facility process. If not, the timer event triggers and the local facility makes repairs again. If the fridge cannot be repaired initially, the local service facility gets parts before triggering the timer event and subsequent repair attempts.

1.text: The process starts when the customer sends their fridge's symptoms and type to the central fridge service center.  The customer then requests an appointment time from a local service facility.  Concurrently, the central fridge service center receives the customer's information, forwards it to a local service facility, and selects a local service facility for the customer. The local service facility receives the report and requests an appointment time from the customer. The customer then makes an appointment with the local service facility. The customer then checks their fridge and confirms if the fridge is OK.  If the customer confirms the fridge is OK, they then rate the facility and the process ends for the customer.  The local service facility receives the fridge’s OK confirmation and the central fridge service center receives the facility rating, after which the process ends.  If the customer doesn’t confirm that the fridge is OK, the local service facility makes repairs.  After repairs, if the fridge is repaired, the customer checks it again, triggering a conditional event.  If the fridge is now OK, the same process follows as described above when the customer initially confirms the fridge is ok. If the fridge is still not OK after repairs, the local service facility gets parts and then makes the repairs again, looping back to the check after the repair. If the local service facility doesn’t have the parts needed for the repair, the facility waits until parts are delivered before continuing the repair and the following steps.  The process then ends for the customer, the local facility and the central facility, as described before.

2.text: The process starts when the customer sends their fridge symptoms and type to the central fridge service center. The central fridge service center receives the report and selects a local service facility.  Simultaneously, the customer makes an appointment with the local service facility, and the central fridge service center sends a notification to the local service facility which receives the report and requests an appointment time from the customer. The customer then sends the requested appointment time to the local service facility which triggers the timer event. The local service facility then makes the repairs. If the fridge is repaired, the customer checks the fridge and confirms if the fridge is OK. If the fridge is not repaired, the local service facility gets parts and tries to repair it again. Meanwhile, the customer sends confirmation to the local service facility, which sends a report back to the central fridge service center, and based on the customer's feedback goes to the conditional event. If the fridge is OK, the process ends for the local service facility. The central fridge service center receives the confirmation from the local service facility.  The customer then rates the facility and sends the rating to the central fridge service center.  Finally, the central fridge service center receives the facility rating, and the process ends.

tasks.name: Receive report and request appointment time

0.text: The 3D Printer process starts when a file is received. The printer heats up the bed and extruder, then sends a status. If the printer is heated up, the object is printed and the process ends. If the printer is not heated up, the bed and extruder are heated again.  Concurrently, the Artist process starts when information is received. A project is created, an STL file generated, and sent to the manufacturer, after which the Artist process ends.  The Manufacturer process begins, sketches and further information are sent to the Artist, initiating communication between the two. The manufacturer chooses a plastic color and checks how much of that color is left.  If the color is not in stock or less than 100g is available, more color is ordered. If the color is in stock, or after ordering, the amount of color is checked again. If more than 100g of the color is available, the manufacturer receives the STL file from the artist, generates a gcode file, and sends the file to the 3D printer; this also initiates communication between the manufacturer and the 3D printer. After the file is sent, the Manufacturer process ends. After the 3D printer receives the file, the process continues until the object is printed.

1.text: The 3D Printer process starts when a file is received. The printer heats up the bed and extruder, then sends a status.  If the printer is heated up, the object is printed and the process ends. If the printer is not heated up, the bed and extruder are heated again. Separately, the Artist process starts when information is received.  A project is created, an STL file generated and sent to the Manufacturer. This ends the Artist process.  Concurrently, the Manufacturer process starts and sketches and further information are sent to the Artist. The Manufacturer chooses a plastic color and checks how much color is left. If the color is not in stock, or less than 100g is left, the color will be ordered, and after it arrives, the amount will be checked again. If there is more than 100g available, or the color was already in stock, the process continues.  The Manufacturer receives the STL file from the Artist, and generates a gcode file.  The gcode file is sent to the printer, ending the Manufacturer's process.  The printer receives the file.

2.text: The 3D Printer process starts when a file is received. The printer then heats up the bed and extruder and sends a status.  If the printer is heated up, the object is printed and the process ends. If not, the bed and extruder are heated again. Concurrently, the Artist process starts when information is received, and a project is created.  Following this, an STL file is generated and sent to the Manufacturer and the Artist process ends. Also concurrently, the Manufacturer process starts, sketches and further information are sent to the Artist, initiating the Artist project creation, after which the manufacturer chooses a plastic color. Next, the manufacturer checks how much color is left. If the color is not in stock or less than 100g is left, more color is ordered, and then the color amount is checked again. If there is enough color in stock (more than 100g), the manufacturer receives the STL file that was sent by the Artist.  A gcode file is then generated from the STL file and sent to the printer, which receives it and triggers the 3D printing sequence that was described at the beginning. Once the file is sent to the 3D printer, the Manufacturer process ends.

0.text: The machine process starts and the machine runs.  The machine then checks the connection. If the connection is established, the machine collects information/measuring.  If the connection is not established, the machine ends the process.  After collecting information, the machine calculates OEE. If the OEE is good, the machine continues collecting information/measuring. If the OEE is too low, the machine stops and, in parallel, an email is sent to the engineer.  After the email is sent and the machine is stopped, the machine process ends.  The engineer process begins and checks emails. Then the engineer finds inefficient equipment and fixes the equipment. Following that, the engineer starts the machine, which sends a message to the machine process to run the machine, and the engineer process ends.

1.text: The machine process starts and runs the machine.  The machine then checks the connection. If the connection is good, the machine collects information/measuring. If the connection is bad, the machine ends the process.  After collecting information, the machine calculates OEE.  If the OEE is good, the machine continues to collect information/measuring. If the OEE is too low, the machine enters a parallel process: the machine stops and, at the same time, an email is sent to the engineer. When the machine has stopped and the email has been sent, the machine process ends.  The engineer process starts and checks emails.  Once an email from the machine is found, the engineer finds inefficient equipment, fixes the equipment, and then starts the machine.  This starting of the machine is communicated back to the machine. When the machine is started by the engineer, the engineer process ends.

2.text: The machine process starts and the machine runs. Then, the machine checks connection. If the machine is connected, information is collected/measured.  If the machine is disconnected, the machine process ends.  The calculated OEE is checked. If the OEE is good, information is collected/measured. If the OEE is too low, the machine is stopped and, in parallel, an e-mail is sent to the engineer. The machine is stopped and the engineer receives the e-mail. Then the machine process ends. The engineer process starts and the engineer checks mails. After checking the mails, the engineer finds inefficient equipment and fixes the equipment.  After fixing the equipment, the engineer starts the machine. After starting the machine, the engineer process ends, and the machine resumes running.
